attributes.additional_details:
Scotland voted in favour of the UK staying in the EU by 62% to 38%.

A majority of voters in all 32 council areas in Scotland voted Remain.

Scottish Labour Leader Kezia Dugdale said the result was bad for jobs and the economy in Scotland and across the UK.
She added that she would be ready to work with Ms Sturgeon in the "best interests of the people of Scotland".
attributes.background:
Recent EU referendum figures shows 62% of the Scottish people voting to remain in the EU, It is unacceptable that Scotland faced the prospect of being taken out of the EU against its will.

Westminster's decisions have yet again fooled the hopes of the Scottish people.

rejection.details:
We think the following petition is similar to yours:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/132667
